<div id="overview">
<div id="overview-box">
<div id="overview-title">
<h1>Overview</h1>
</div>

<div id="overview-col2">
Impulse response functions only measure the total effect of a shock or policy.  What if we wanted to know how this total effect comes to be, i.e. what if we wanted to understand how the shock or policy work? **Transmission Channel Analysis allows for the decomposition of impulse response functions into the effects along channels.** Each channel corresponds to one mechanism behind the shock or the policy. 

<div id="overview-example">
<div id="overview-example-text">
### Example

Wegner et al (2024) use Transmission Channel Analysis (TCA) to decompose the impulse response functions of a contractionary monetary policy shock. They are able to quantify the expectations channel within a theoretical model and show that expectations play a key role in the transmission of monetary policy. 

Sice TCA decomposes the impulse response function, Wegner et al (2024) are able to produce a decomposition plot, showing their results graphically.

<a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2405.18987" class="overview-btn" style="background-color: var(--bs-orange);">Check the Paper</a>
</div>
<div id="overview-example-figure"><img src="assets/landing-example-fig.png" alt="Decomposition of contractionary monetary policy shock"></div>
</div>

### How do I cite TCA?

If you use TCA or any of the packages in your research, we would appreciate if you could cite the original paper. This is currently the best way.

::: {#about-how-to-cite}
```{.tex}
@misc{wegner2024transmissionchannelanalysisdynamic,
  title={Transmission Channel Analysis in Dynamic Models}, 
  author={Enrico Wegner and Lenard Lieb and Stephan Smeekes and Ines Wilms},
  year={2024},
  eprint={2405.18987},
  archivePrefix={arXiv},
  primaryClass={econ.EM},
  url={https://arxiv.org/abs/2405.18987
} 
```
:::

### Why make this website?

While some might argue that making this website was a waste of our time and we would have done better by using this time to further research on TCA and related methods, we disagree. Sure, making this website and the software packages took time, but we also believe that a new methodological method can only be impactful if appropriate software implementations are provided. Moreover, we believe that a successful new methodology requires good scientific communication, bridging the gap between practitioners and researchers. This website is our best try in bridging the gap and providing the tools that practitioners need to successfully implement TCA.
